summary: This is an email chain from September 2021 regarding a technical investigation into failed hard drives from video recording systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The correspondence involves a Department of Justice Inspector General agent and a contractor from SigNet Technologies, discussing the loss of video data from August 2019, the period around Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: U.S. Department of Justice Inspector General Agent
persons.context: The DOJ OIG agent is investigating the failure of video recording drives from the MCC in August 2019 and is requesting a summary report and communications from a contractor.

events.title: Second hard drive failure at MCC
events.description: A second hard drive in the video recording system at the Metropolitan Correctional Center failed, causing the RAID array to fail and resulting in the loss of video recording capability.

events.title: FBI examination of MCC drives
events.description: The FBI brought a contractor to Quantico to analyze hard drives taken from the MCC's video recording system.

events.title: Contractor clearance to respond
events.description: A contractor from SigNet Technologies states they had to get clearance from the FBI to respond to the DOJ OIG due to a previously signed non-disclosure agreement.

locations: One Battery Park Plaza, 29th Floor, New York, NY 10004
12300 Kiln a Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705 (SigNet Technologies office)
keyFacts: Video recording systems at the MCC lost data due to two consecutive hard drive failures in August 2019.
The second drive failure on August 8, 2019, caused a complete RAID array failure, resulting in a loss of recording capability.
A contractor from SigNet Technologies, working under an FBI contract, examined the failed drives at Quantico.
The contractor had signed a non-disclosure agreement with the FBI, delaying their response to the DOJ Office of the Inspector General.
The DOJ OIG is investigating the drive failures and seeking a report, email communications, and contact information related to the incident.
